name: La Quinta Inn & Suites Boston Somerville

reviews.text: We stay here every year for Boston Marathon weekend. The location is perfect, 2 miles from Boston and best of all accessible by subway so you can park your car all weekend. The rooms are clean and the staff if friendly and helpful. The manager at this La Quinta is professional and personable. She cares about the guests that stay here and remembers us each year. Breakfast is just what we are looking for and the waffles are the best, fresh and made to order.
reviews.title: Best hidden gem outside of Boston...

reviews.text: Overall, this place was relatively easy to get to. A restaurant was almost in the parking lot. (99s and it was good for a chain). The hotel definitely left things to be desired but if you need a place to sleep and don't care that it might be right at the highway...this is truly good for your money. Hotel staff are adequate, the gym is never in use, and the ice cream vending machines are always open. For a nights stay this place is great. If you want something more than basic....pay more for something closer. But you don't need to. Also, bring your own toiletries.
reviews.title: basic for the price in Boston

reviews.text: We stayed at the La Quinta for one night to visit a college in Boston. After reading the reviews, I decided to stay there even though they only have 2.5 stars. Like others have said the front desk is the friendliest and nicest I have experienced in a very long time. The GM actually checked us in and she couldn't have been nicer.
reviews.title: Great place to stay for a college visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was a regular hotel room, nothing fancy, but it was clean and that's what matters most.
reviews.title: Great place to stay while in Boston

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I do have to say lighting was an issue for me, especially when putting on my make up and the rubber seal on the refrigerator was hanging off, the room needed a new refrigerator. It did keep our bottle of soda cold but I wouldn't have put any food in it.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Excellent locations

reviews.text: I spent several nights at LQ Somerville in late May 2013. The Assembly Square neighborhood around the hotel is going through some extensive upgrades and new construction, plus with the new MBTA station opening in the fall of 2014, this hotel will no doubt be in a great location. The rooms were adequate and the beds offered a very comfortable sleep with no issue regarding cleanliness. In my opinion, the rooms due lack modern décor but are typical of the majority of American hotels in room décor, which makes it difficult to believe that the hotel was built in 2000 according to some sources. Simple little things such as a bottle open and those metal tissue paper dispenser attached to the vanity offer more of flash back to hotels of previous decades than one built in the 2000s. Overlooking these little “eye flaws”, the room was very clean and temperature was controllable by the guest. We had no noise issue with the proximity of the Interstation 93 or the neighborhood construction. Adjacent to the front door of the hotel is the 99 Restaurant, a chain of family restaurants in New England, which can offer plenty of options and spot to grab a drink. For those “out of towners”, the neighborhood is relatively safe though I would say I would recommend walking from the T-Station after midnight. The hotel offers complimentary shuttle service to the MBTA station (Sullivan Station - Orange Line) as well as the airport. The shuttle runs at the top of each hour however a taxi to/from Sullivan Station will cost approx. $6.00. I had a couple disappointments: The hotel’s breakfast was a bit of a disappointment, not so much due to its selection but because of the confined space of the breakfast room. The area is too small and we decided to skip the breakfast just to avoid the aggravation of the tight quarters (the lobby can also be tight especially during check out time). Thankfully, there is a Dunkin Donuts within 150 steps from the front door of the hotel. Then there is the “pool” which was really a 3.5ft. deep Endless pool. While my son was in the pool, at least 4 people walked in to look at the pool, only to ask me “is this it?!” and then walk back out. Signs on the wall add to the confusion… it is a “pool” or a “spa”? In the end, the LQ Somerville was a positive stay and I would certainly return again if the price is right.
reviews.title: Great Spot with Bright Future
A wonderful place to stay
reviews.text: My husband and I have stayed at the LaQuinta in Somerville numerous times when we have been in Boston for appointments. It is always a delightful experience. The rooms are in top condition and extremely clean. The continental breakfast is excellent, and we appreciate having free shuttle service available. The staff is friendly and helpful, and will immediately attend to any needs we might have. We plan on staying there again

My partner and I needed a place to stay at the last minute because of a family emergency. Through Booking.com, we found La Quinta Inn and Suites. It WAS PERFECT! The room was clean, comfortable, quiet, and the amenities were perfect. The staff was welcoming, professional, and accommodating. It is centrally located and within minutes of Boston proper. We would highly recommend it to anyone and will stay there again. Thank you, La Quinta Inn!
reviews.title: The best ever

reviews.text: I really loved this hotel!!! We stayed here for a week in a suite and it was wonderful!!! It was big with lovely views of Somerville. Also, there is a shopping center right across the street and a Dunkin Donuts two minutes away...which are both easy to walk to. The breakfast was above average, but the coffee is horrible! Thank goodness for Dunkin Donuts! Also, do not expect a "pool" or "spa." It was more like a large bathtub. The pool room was freezing, and the pool was unbearably cold. I was hoping the pool would be heated since the room was cold, but no such luck.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel...perfect for families
Pleasant surprise
reviews.text: It was very clean here, and the room was in perfect condition. The beds were very comfortable, and the hotel was very quiet.

reviews.title: Good enough
reviews.text: We did have a wonderful stay and the staff were very friendly. We were here during the winter storm, and had beautiful views and easy walking access without driving on the snowy roads. I would definitely recommend the suite...It was the perfect size for a family of 4.

We had stayed here previously with a good experience. This time not so good. There were three of us, my husband and I and a visitor to the United States for the 1st time, who stayed on the pull-out couch, which literally was like sleeping on metal springs against your body. (our bed was quite comfortable). could hear noise between rooms, but not horrible. the worst part was 1st day we were given a card with a phone number and told to call when we got back to the train station from downtown Boston, which we did (actually called from Boston as we were getting onto the T) and were told that they only came on the hour, thus a long wait in store for us, so we ended up getting a cab - no easy task as they don't sit at the train station. second day, we planned for the hourly arrival of the van, which somehow never arrived until almost a half hour late - we were told one van was down. we were cold and unhappy by the time we returned. so, mixed bag, the good part, clean and relatively inexpensive if you want to put up with the inconveniences. definitely impossible sleeping on the "pull out sofabed" which you might as well not open up. (also though much of the staff was friendly, our first greeting was by a stony faced, unhappy seeming young woman)
reviews.title: mixed review

reviews.text: You know what I love about walking into La Quinta? Consistency of kindness. I'd used them in Arkansas, Memphis and Orlando. This was my first foray into the Boston area La Quintas, and when I walked in, a smile and a kind word greeted me. Check in was fast and pleasant. The room was new looking, clean and set to an excellent temperature. Bed is fantastically comfortable, and they even use the good pillows! I'm a Boston Cannons season ticket owner, despite living in NY. I'm already book into the La Quinta for next weekend's game. I'll be staying there all season. And it's RIGHT next to a good restaurant, AND shopping if I forget any necessities!
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable and kind
college visit to Boston
reviews.text: La Quinta Inn & Suites in Boston Sommerville was a perfectly acceptable hotel. The sheets were clean and the bed was very comfortable. I stayed only 1 night so I can't rate the houskeeping service. The bathroom was dated but relatively clean. I'm very picky about hotel bathrooms and this was clean enough for one shower. Neighborhood is a bit sketchy and not beautiful by any means but very convenient to Boston.

I was in Boston for 3 nights and had a dream that rather than staying at the Westin Waterfront (where my conference was based), I'd go a little bit further out and have a room with free Wi-Fi where I could smoke and drink gallons of coffee.
reviews.title: Great Bargain for Boston, But That's All

reviews.text: The hotel was fine -- strong Internet connection, good water pressure, clean room but here, let me be really petty. I have a dog so I stay at La Quintas all the time. This is the only one I've seen that has zero coffee available after breakfast ends at 9:00. See? I told you it was petty. Oh, and while I'm being so petty, let me say that I don't understand a hotel cable system that carries Fox News but not its counterpart, MSNBC. Hellloooo -- it's BOSTON!!
reviews.title: great place outside of Boston

aka: La Quinta Inn And Suites Boston Somerville
